summary:
--REQUIRES DAWNGUARD--
Adds a very crappy crossbow to the Aetherium Forge.
descriptionHtml:
Woah, I made something that ISN\'T a useless storage facility? You best believe it! On to the good news!

DON\'T USE V2 YET. IT APPARENTLY CRASHES UNDER EVEN MORE ABSURD CIRCUMSTANCES!

--------------
New Item
--------------
Makeshift Dwarven Crossbow
- Made of junk. Literally.
- Gears and pipes to fit your poorly-conceived steampunk needs!
-- No steam included. 
-- Gears don\'t move. Well, they do, but only in the inventory screen.
- Heavy. 50~ pounds.
- Packs a wallop! Hits harder than Dragonbone weapons, AND ignores 50% armor.
- Reloads slower than regular crossbows. Really slow. Accident, but made it more interesting.

I\'ll be blunt; I literally threw together a crossbow made of dwarven clutter and dungeon items. Each part is something you either pick up from the dungeons, or is part of the scenery in them. I made this as a joke, and I don\'t really intend on making it any better. At least not now, since I\'m no good with models. Uses textures from ingame, no new ones.

UPDATE V2:
Adds an alternate version with the exact same stats to the exact same location. It looks the same, save for having the side curves removed. Both can also be tempered if you have Dwarven Smithing.

------------------------------------
BUGS - VERY IMPORTANT
------------------------------------
- No animation. I\'m stupid, and I can\'t figure it out.
- Crashes the game if you drop it. DON\'T DO THAT. Put it in a chest or something.
- Lots of clipping when held.
- Crashes if you switch between both crossbow variants. Unequip one, then equip the other.
- Version 2 - Crashes if you unequip either one. I don\'t quite understand how that happened.

Still looking for any other bugs that are here.

--------------
Uninstall:
--------------
Remove the file - data\\meshes\\dlc01\\weapons\\dwarven crossbow\\superbow.nif
Remove the file - data\\Dawnguard Mod - Advanced Crossbow.esp
author: Campaigner
